comments.commentBody: After all of this...all I really want to know is, what shoes did these girls choose as their favorites?!

A liberal, by definition, is tolerant and inclusive. Fascists, by definition, are authoritarian and intolerant. "Visceral hatred" has no part in liberal philosophy; in saying that liberals have a visceral hatred of religion, you are incorrectly imputing a right-wing characteristic.

What you see as visceral hatred is simply an inability to understand why religion is a required factor for elected office in a country founded on the notion of separation of church and state.
Why is Kansas so crazy?

I am a liberal and an Atheist, but I don't hate religion.  I cherish the First Amendment right that allows religious belief to flourish.  However, what does profoundly concern me are the assaults on separation of government from religion, the extremely erroneous historical revisionism that purports this nation to be founded as a Christian nation, and the anti-intellectual threat to public schools' science curricula.

The real issue is not differences between evangelicals and Mormons but with liberals and leftists who hate them both and want nothing more than for them to attack each other during this election season.

Liberals in the media have a visceral hatred of religion, the exceptions being "good" Christians on the religious left, liberal Jews and those members of any religion who are wisely abandoning their faith. Evangelicals are especially evil because of their support for conservative candidates. Mormons are an easy target because they're easy to stereotype.

So, what you're going to see is the issue being framed as religious intolerance between two Christian denominations and not the reflexive contempt the liberal media holds for both of them, which is why these differences will get the news coverage that they do. The idea that every Mormon is magically responsible for anything every other Mormon has ever done -- such as polygamy -- and that every evangelical is responsible for everything every other evangelical has ever said is going to be a prominent theme. Watch for it.
A president with the priesthood.
Excellent points here.  NYT should highlight this one, IMO.

He gave $6M over the last two years. Did you?

And did he get $6M in services from the government?

Concerned: he paid 15% effective tax rate. Stop looking at absolute #'s to justify how much he paid. He didn't pay enough taxes. He didn't pay his "fair" share.

He lobbied Congress to get the cap gains lowered.

He rigged the system to his unfair advantage.

I would say "no" to your question. He got about twice as much gov't service as the guy paying 30% in effective taxes.

Do we want a president who does not want to give an extra dollar to the nation?

What Evangelicals and all other citizens should be concerned about Mitt is the feelings he has about this nation as expressed in one of the more recent debates. He prides himself in not giving one more dollar in taxes than is legally required. He must spend a fortune to be certain of this. What does that say about how he fells about this country?

Our soldiers are giving much more than extra dollar. Many of them them are giving limbs, sanity, memory, the future well being of their children, wife and their parents.

And Mitt does not want to give an extra dollar?
Shame. Could an enemy of this nation be any more damning?
Delusional indeed.
Excellent!  This could easily be the best bumper sticker of the year.
funny comment but he probably  would want the same for you (the god part) , he definately wants the presidency and everybody can`t be president
A president today, a god tomorrow?  Sounds ambitious to me.

Thanks, Jake, for your excellent post. While as a liberal Democrat I'd be very disappointed if Romney were elected,  as an evangelical Christian I'm looking for the best leader for the country, whether that person is Christian or not. That is part of what Jesus meant when he said, "give to Caesar what is Caesar's, give to God what is God's."

The so-called "Christian" definition of God that you reference is not set forth in the Bible, but was rather decided in the secular Council of Nicea. This belief is a fundamental difference between Mormons and Protestants. However, by definition, a Christian is someone who believes in Christ. Mormons obviously believe in Christ (that he was the only begotten Son of the Father and that he atoned for our sins). Saying that someone isn't Christian because they don't believe in all of your man-made concepts of God is logically dishonest .

However, from all measures, neither Obama nor Newt Gingrich appear to have much, if any, faith in Christ. Newt certainly has no ethics, but Evangelicals are still willing to vote for him over a Mormon.

Mormonism denies  fundamental tenents of Christianity. That God existed in eternity (ask a mormon "who created God" and insist they answer the question and eventually you will get mormon doctrine: "We don't know". It is a trick question meant to reveal the differences between classic Christianty and Mormonism. No Christian would answer the question with that answer. God existed in eternity - He always was. Having said that they do share the ethics of Christianity - which to many evangelicals is enough - we are not voting for a pastor who needs correct theology to lead a flock. We are voting for a president who will lead a nation.
I prefer the term "imaginary sky being".
It really matters whose sky wizard is better than someone else's?  They're all just sky wizards ...

*English 107 Article: A Scientific Look at the Dangers of High Heels

Heels Hurt Her

Many women believe that if wearing a certain shoe hurts, it means that the shoes look great. Even though this may be somewhat accurate, abusing the use of high heels can cause straining of muscles and tendons. For example, even though "scientists found that heel wearers moved with shorter, more forceful strides and their feet perpetually in a flexed, toes-pointed position as opposed to those without heels", heel wearers continue to put unnceccesasry strain on their calf muscles even when they take off their heels. The best advice doctors can provide is to limit the use of high heels.
It is safe to assume that many girls, young ladies and women are familiar with the phrase, " Beauty Hurts" My mother would say this to me in order to bring both humor and encourage me to endure the painful situation of waxing my eyebrows. This phrase, which can easily be considered as a motto is the reason why women wear heels even when it leaves their feet sore and blistered. For those of us who work, there is nothing wrong with bringing another pair of flat shoes in our purse or bag. It is true that beauty hutrs, but we can decide on whether or not fashion is more important than the health of our feet.
You said it better than I could.

Hey Mr. Friedman, this is not honest work by above average workers.

If you live in a dormitory and can be woken up in the middle of the night at the whim of your boss to work endless hours for virtually no pay, it is called slavery. That's what we are competing with in the global economy.

People want these jobs in China because there is nothing else. I will never teach my children to allow themselves to be exploited like that.

Americans need to learn to pay more for things and have less.
People need to be paid for the work they do, and corporations need to stop putting almighty profits first.

This is supposedly Tom Friedman's desire for what he wants America to be like.  Where humans are back to having almost no rights whatsoever.  Pretty scary, eh?  Think about that the next Friedman writes a glowing piece about China.

Well, as it happens, I am now 71. I wore flat shoes most of my life.

I wish somebody had told me that pronation was the cause of bunions, so I didn't have to have surgery to correct them. I continued to wear flat shoes, and the bunion on one foot came back. Even an arch support in flat shoes does not correct the pronation as effectively as a high heel does.

I discovered the benefits of wearing heels by accident and have worn them ever since. The bunion is no longer getting any worse. As it happens, the podiatrist who I now see agrees with me that the high heel is beneficial. He laughed and said, "whatever works"; And I can tell you it is far better than having surgery again.

I also think they look terrific on a woman and they make me feel young at heart. And you couldn't get me to wear a pair of those ugly running shoes -- they look like you stepped in a big wad of bubble gum and it dried on your feet.

In pursuing our desire for more stuff at lower prices we join in the worldwide race to the bottom, especially in terms of human rights.

We should bring manufacturing back to the US. Labor must be strengthened and given a much more prominent voice.

Ordinary folks would be unhappy because they would have less stuff, and it would cost more.

As Sam Walton knows, getting people to accept paying more is a huge problem.

Billionaire CEO's, who buy our politicians, would surely object.

But we Americans would once more have enough. Poverty, violence, and suffering would decrease.

We would also reduce suffering in other parts of the world if what we did import was manufactured with higher health and safety standards...even if the products cost a little more.
Oh no! I used to be a chronic stiletto junkie. I've been sticking to flats for the past year or so... I wonder how long it takes for your walking style to get back to "normal?"
Make sure your flipflops have some arch support.  A fallen arch takes a second to happen, and causes a lifetime of pain.

Actually, flip flops can cause a slew of problems as well.  While they are not as obviously damaging to feet as high heels, flip flops are cause problems for the feet, especially if they are worn on sidewalks and streets over long periods of time.

I tore my plantar fasciitis last year from excessive wearing of flip flops -- a better choice is a sold sandal with a thick supportive sole, and straps to hold it on your feet.

Shoes like flip flops demand you "hold on" with your toes, and this is stressful over time. There is also zero arch support!
Sexy?  There is nothing attractive about the hammer toes, bunions and generally deformed feet they cause.  I prefer women in flip flops with healthy feet.
Will you stop using a cell phone altogether, then? Because the next phone you buy will employ the same folks making the same wage to make the same product. It's not just Apple. It's the industry.

Yes, I was thinking of downgrading to a "dumb" phone, and I do believe when the time comes, after some careful research, I can find a cellphone (and a company) that will satisfy my needs.

But most importantly, my love affair with Apple products (hardware and software) is coming to an end (a user and buyer since 1989). The equipment I have now will last for a couple of more years (hopefully), and by that time, hopefully, something Better and more Insanely Great will come along.

@Hysterical: the point isn't that other companies do not manufacture in China. They ALL do.

The point is that other products are not hyped as "Zen Buddhist hippie cool futuristic Star Trek stuff from the future", nor their CEO as some kind of magical cool cat who is a combo of Einstein, Edison and Da Vinci.

When you buy a Droid or Galaxy phone, you don't stand in line for hours or camp out in front of the store, just to have the latest Apple gewgaw you can show off to your friends.

Most other products do NOT have the ability to mark their stuff up so much, because of the elite SWPL status about it.

(*Stuff White People Like)

After reading this story (and Sunday's), I am ashamed to admit that I own Apple computers, iPods, iPhone, and iPad. When my iPhone contract with AT&T expires in May, I will give serious consideration whether or not to buy another Apple product.

To Mr. Steve Jobs, wherever you are, and to Mr. Tim Cook, I ask: "What price glory?"

I think that a certain high end popular shoe is comfortable.  I normally wear flats however with this shoe company, I can wear a 3 3/4 inch casual sandal and feel comfortable all day long, so I go with them. I recently broke in a new 2 inch casual patent loafer on the streets of NYC, walked in them all day with comfort.  In watching a certain TLC show, I learned from one of the hosts that expensive shoes are engineered differently, so you can wear a 3 inch heel all day without pain. So I take it to mean that great design and comfort can go hand in hand. Well made shoes are totally worth paying extra for.

The Chinese government subsidizes these factories so that they can make the labor even cheaper than market rates. They're not going to do anything to make things any more expensive than they have to. They've got a great deal going now. And did you know that the most popular luxury car in China is the Audi? Where does all that money come from to buy such pricey cars? The folks who drive those cars also have air filters in their offices to keep out the pollution.

Another reason why capitalism is evil. While it fuels innovation, it abuses human rights. Unfortunately, I'm one of the millions who who admire Apple. Their products are brilliant, and Steve Jobs was creative and intelligent, but Apple, Jobs, and other big companies have blood on their hands.

Having said that, the worst part is that these workers in China won't have it any better even if Apple and other companies were to stop giving them work. Ultimately, taking any meaningful action is the responsibility of the Chinese government, which is worse than any capitalist country out there.

It's time for the little people of the world to come together and stop the abusive practices of the rich and powerful.

Good point. It is precisely because of this 9/11 attack that my shoes have to pass the "can I run out of a burning building with them" test. My shoes always pass this test. To hell with  additional height, I am tall enough (5'9").
Not just a rich man's greed.  It's all of us.

Oh dear me, slavery?   No, no, no.   They have "restaurants and movie theaters ... and swimming pools" which they squeeze in after those generous 12 hour days or their one day off a week!    And don't forget the hospital.   Free health-care for when the factory blows up.

What a great idea!! Let's add a "human rights tax" and a "working conditions tax", and a "carbon tax"...
Maybe Kent can think up some more ways government can help us fix this Apple problem...
Chinese factory workers are treated like literal slaves.  They do not aspire to owning an iPad or iPhone.
Yeah, I'm a Mac user from way back.  This is disgusting.  Makes me want to go Luddite.

From Mitch Daniels' Republican rebuttal to Obama's State of the Union Address (these are Daniels' exact words): “Contrary to the President’s constant disparagement of people in business, it’s one of the noblest of human pursuits.  The late Steve Jobs — what a fitting name he had — created more of them than all those stimulus dollars the President borrowed and blew. "
And Foxconn makes many of those too.
